meanings.definition: A member of the Ku Klux Klan responsible for recruiting new members.
meanings.sent1: The kleagle welcomed new members into the Ku Klux Klan.
meanings.sent2: The kleagle's role was to bring in fresh faces to the Ku Klux Klan.
meanings.sent3: The kleagle tried to convince people to join the Ku Klux Klan, but not many were interested.
meanings.sent4: In the dark of night, the kleagle's whispers echoed through the woods, calling for new recruits.
meanings.sent5: The image of the hooded kleagle standing at the Klan meeting was chilling and unforgettable.

meanings.definition: To act as a recruiter for the Ku Klux Klan.
meanings.sent1: He decided to kleagle for the Ku Klux Klan to increase their numbers.
meanings.sent2: She kleagled tirelessly, trying to persuade individuals to join the Ku Klux Klan.
meanings.sent3: The town was shocked when he announced his plan to kleagle for the Ku Klux Klan.
meanings.sent4: Her words kleagled through the community, stirring up both curiosity and fear.
meanings.sent5: The idea of having to kleagle for such a hateful group made him uneasy.
